item.title: Ubuntu and Nvidia Optimus
item.description: How to: Make Nvidia Optimus work after installing Ubuntu 21.04. I own a Thinkpad T480 with a dedicated GPU (Nvidia Geforce MX 150) in addition to the onboard Intel GPU. The easiest way to have a Linux distribution with full Optimus support running would be to download the most recent PopOS! image with the proprietary Nvidia drivers baked in. Since I cannot stand some of the modifications System76 made to Gnome I just want to get the most recent Ubuntu (or Kubuntu) version and go from there.
